titlealts.searchtitle: NHS Business Definition: Systemic Anti-cancer Therapy Drug Regimen - Description

div.p: A Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Drug Regimen is an Anti-Cancer Drug Regimen.
A Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Drug Regimen identifies a standard for a combination of drugs (or single drug) given in a planned schedule.
A Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Drug Regimen can be standard, part of a CLINICAL TRIAL or specifically designed for an individual treatment plan.

The Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Drug Regimen title will be as agreed by the Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy team and an NHS support Pharmacists group as they maintain the regimen list and this will inform the OPCS Classification of Interventions and Procedures Guidance.
